body_html:
This is really a tradeoff between two sides of TF users.
On one hand, TF is highly performance sensitive. Anything that can make TF faster, users may want to be aware of it. When we did not have some of these messasges, we received a lot of complaints that TF was silently slow, and users had no idea TF was slow.

On the other end of the spectrum is your point of view, where you would like it to "just work" without any cryptic messages.

Assigning to @martinwicke

Assigning to @martinwicke
body:
This is really a tradeoff between two sides of TF users.
On one hand, TF is highly performance sensitive. Anything that can make TF faster, users may want to be aware of it. When we did not have some of these messasges, we received a lot of complaints that TF was silently slow, and users had no idea TF was slow.

On the other end of the spectrum is your point of view, where you would like it to "just work" without any cryptic messages.

Assigning to @martinwicke
